meanings.definition: The delusion of one's own power or importance.
meanings.sent1: His megalomanias made him believe he could control the entire world.
meanings.sent2: Her megalomanias often led her to overestimate her abilities.
meanings.sent3: The cat's megalomanias were evident when it tried to take on a much larger dog.
meanings.sent4: The politician's megalomanias reached such heights that he saw himself as a god among men.
meanings.sent5: The megalomanias of the villain made him a formidable foe for the hero.

meanings.definition: An obsession with grandiose or extravagant things.
meanings.sent1: Her megalomanias were evident in her desire for a mansion with a private zoo.
meanings.sent2: The billionaire's megalomanias were reflected in his collection of luxury cars.
meanings.sent3: The megalomanias of the child were revealed in his wish for a life-sized robot.
meanings.sent4: His megalomanias were like a bottomless pit of desire for opulence.
meanings.sent5: The megalomanias of the queen led to the construction of a golden palace.

meanings.definition: A mental disorder characterized by delusions of grandeur.
meanings.sent1: His megalomanias were a sign of his deteriorating mental health.
meanings.sent2: The psychiatrist diagnosed him with megalomanias after his grandiose claims.
meanings.sent3: The megalomanias of the patient made him believe he was a historical figure.
meanings.sent4: Living in his megalomanias, he saw himself as the ruler of a vast empire.
meanings.sent5: The megalomanias of the artist fueled his belief in his divine artistic talent.
